Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2019 IEEE Global Communications Conference (IEEE GLOBECOM 2019)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The 2019 Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) Global Communications Conference (GLOBECOM 2019) will be held in Waikoloa on the Big Island, Hawaii, USA, during 9 -13 December 2019. This preeminent technical conference is one of the two flagship conferences of the IEEE Communications Society, and a primary venue for presenting new research results in the area of communications and networking. It is widely attended by researchers and practitioners in the field. Attending conferences such as Globecom is of paramount importance for the development of graduate and undergraduate students. Participants have the opportunity to present their work, attend panel and keynote sessions, and interact with hundreds of other leading-edge researchers in the field.

This proposal provides travel support for approximately sixteen graduate and undergraduate students in the United States to attend this premiere conference. The travel awards will give priority considerations to first-time attendees and under-represented minority students, since attending conferences is an important part of their educational experience, and they often have limited travel funds. The research community and the Engineering workforce benefit from the improvement of students in the pipeline, and the introduction of new researcher perspectives.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project aims at funding undergraduate or graduate students from US universities to attend IEEE GLOBECOM 2019 regardless of their citizenship/visa status.   National Science Foundation (NSF) has been generously supporting Student Travel Grants for IEEE GLOBECOM 2019, thus playing an instrumental role in establishing this widely successful program.  It successfully boosted the participation of US-based students in GLOBECOM. With the travel grant offered by the conference, some outstanding students who cannot receive fund support from their research institutes have been financially capable to participate GLOBECOM.

In total IEEE Globecom 2019 NSF STG received 61 applications from US based universities and 16 students were awarded STG to attend IEEE GC 2019. The detailed names and schools of the awarded students are listed in the IEEE Globecom 2019 website as follows:  https://globecom2019.ieee-globecom.org/program/student-travel-grant-winners

The IEEE GC 2019 NSF STG funded students were exposed to the state-of-the-art researches in the field of communications and networking. They also had the opportunity to interact with peers from institutions worldwide, met with leading researchers from both industry and academia, and took part in discussions that may shape the future of the field (in terms of technology, standards, services, etc). Through communications with people, graduating students also collected job information, introduced their research and demonstrate their capabilities to potential employers, and got knowing people who can serve as references for their job applications.

In total 2688 attended IEEE Globecom  2019, among which 714 were from USA, 682 from China, 155 from Korea, 128 from Japan, 121 from Canada,  86 from France, 75 from Great Britain, 68 from Taiwan, 60 from Germany, 52 from Australia, 22 from Brazil, others: 319.

  • 69% of respondents were “satisfied” or “very satisfied” with GLOBECOM 2019
  • 55% of attendees were first timer
  • 60% rated GLOBECOM 2019 as high value both in terms of conference experience and cost to attend
  • Main motivations for attending GLOBECOM 2019: to present (79%); learn about latest research (63%); network (55%)
  • Most relevant technical sessions: Wireless communications (85%); Next Generation Networking and Internet (76%); Communications QoS, Reliability and Modeling (69%)
